b2bpl.translation
Class MethodTranslator

java.lang.Object
  b2bpl.translation.MethodTranslator
All Implemented Interfaces:
TranslationConstants
public class MethodTranslator
extends java.lang.Object
implements TranslationConstants

The main entry point to the translation of a bytecode method to a BoogiePL procedure.

Some aspects of the translation process can be configured by passing an appropriate Project instance containing the desired translation settings upon creating the MethodTranslator. In particular, the following aspects of the translation can be configured:

  • The verification methodology for object invariants (see Project.isThisInvariantsOnly()).
  • Whether to explicitly model runtime exceptions instead of ruling them out by verification conditions (see Project.isModelRuntimeExceptions()).

The MethodTranslator is responsible for the following aspects of the translation process:

  • The translation of the individual bytecode instructions and the method's program flow.
  • The generation of a set of assumptions justified by the JVM environment. This mainly includes the translation of the method's static type information but also the modeling of properties guaranteed by the JVM such as the fact that the this object is never aliased at the beginning of a constructor.
  • The translation of the local BML specifications such as assertions, assumptions, and loop specifications.
  • The generation of proof obligations as well as assumptions as required or justified, respectively, by the verification methodology used. This mainly includes the handling of object invariants and method specifications according to the verification methodology.
The actual translation of BML specification expressions and store references is thereby not performed directly by the MethodTranslator but instead delegated to the SpecificationTranslator and ModifiesFilter classes, respectively.

Author:
Ovidio Mallo
See Also:
Project.isThisInvariantsOnly(), Project.isModelRuntimeExceptions(), SpecificationTranslator, ModifiesFilter

loopHeapVars

The variables which store a copy of the current heap at each loop header. These variables are dynamically "allocated" during the translation of the method.

The variables which store the value of loop variant expressions at each loop header. These variables are dynamically "allocated" during the translation of the method.

Constructor Detail

MethodTranslator

public MethodTranslator(Project project)
Creates a new method translator which is configured by the given project. Once a translator has been created, it can be used to translate different bytecode methods under the same configuration (given by the here provided project).

Parameters:
project - The project containing the configurations of the translation.
See Also:
translate(TranslationContext, BCMethod)
Method Detail

public BPLProcedure translate(TranslationContext context,
                              BCMethod method)
Performs the actual translation of the given bytecode method and returns a BoogiePL procedure representing it.

Parameters:
context - The TranslationContext to be used for translating type/field/constant/... references.
method - The bytecode method to be translated.
Returns:
The BoogiePL procedure resulting from the translation of the given bytecode method.

buildProcedure

private BPLProcedure buildProcedure()
Builds and the return the actual BoogiePL procedure resulting from the translation of the bytecode method. This method should be called once the actual translation of the method body has finished.

Returns:
The BoogiePL procedure resulting from the translation of the given bytecode method.

getProcedureName

private java.lang.String getProcedureName(BCMethod method)
Returns the name to use for the BoogiePL procedure resulting from the translation of the given bytecode method. The returned string is a valid BoogiePL identifier and it is guaranteed to be different from the procedure name returned for any different method (including overloaded methods).

Parameters:
method - The bytecode method for which to return the BoogiePL procedure name.
Returns:
The BoogiePL procedure name.

getInParameters

private java.lang.String[] getInParameters()
Convenience method returning the names of the in-parameter names of the BoogiePL procedure being generated.

Returns:
The names of the procedure's in-parameters.

translateInit

private void translateInit()
Generates a set of assumptions justified by the JVM and its type system. In addition, the initialization of the first stack frame of the method is translated to BoogiePL. The information assumed at this point and guaranteed by the JVM includes the following:
  • The this object, if any, is never null.
  • The types of the parameter values are subtypes of their static types and all reachable values are alive.
  • If we are inside a constructor, the this object is not aliased and its instance fields are initialized by their default values.

initTranslation

private void initTranslation()
Initializes the internal state of the translator. Should be called whenever a new bytecode method is translated.

translatePre

private void translatePre()
Generates a set of assumptions justified by the verification methodology employed. In particular, the following is assumed at the beginning of the method:
  • The invariants of all objects, eventually excluding the this object in case we are inside a constructor.
  • The method's effective precondition.

translatePost

private void translatePost()
Generates a set of assertions for normal as well as exceptional terminations of the method being translated in order to enforce the desired verification methodology. In particular, the following assertions need to be satisfied when the method terminates:
  • The method's effective (exceptional) postcondition must hold.
  • The invariants of the method's receiver type must hold for all relevant objects, even if the method terminates with an exception.
  • The method's frame condition must hold, even if the method terminates with an exception.

translateInstructions

private void translateInstructions()
Translates the method's bytecode instructions along with all the local BML annotations (assertions, loop specifications, ...). The translation of the program flow follows the method's control flow graph.

assumeAllInvariants

private void assumeAllInvariants(boolean excludeThisObject)
Assumes all invariants of all objects, eventually excluding the this object.

Parameters:
excludeThisObject - Whether to exclude the this object from the set of objects on which the invariants are assumed.

assertExposedInvariants

private void assertExposedInvariants(boolean excludeThisObject)
Generates proof obligations for verifying the invariants of all the objects which are considered to be exposed, meaning that their invariants may have been broken.

Parameters:
excludeThisObject - Whether to exclude the this object from the set of objects on which the invariants are checked.

translateInstructionAnnotations

private void translateInstructionAnnotations(InstructionHandle insn)
Translates the local BML annotations (assertions, assumptions, ...) attached to the given instruction.

Parameters:
insn - The instruction handle at which to translate the local BML annotations.

translateCFGBlockStart

private void translateCFGBlockStart(BasicBlock cfgBlock)
Translates the start of a new basic block in the method's control flow graph. Beside starting a new BoogiePL block, this method also handles the translation of loop headers by inserting all the loop invariants resulting from BML specifications (loop specifications) but also from the verification methodology itself.

Parameters:
cfgBlock - The basic block of the method's control flow graph to start.

endBlock

private void endBlock(java.lang.String... labels)

Parameters:
labels - The labels identifying the BoogiePL blocks to which the block being closed should branch.

endBlock

private void endBlock(Edge cfgEdge)
Ends the currently active BoogiePL block by a transfer command which branches to the BoogiePL block representing the target of the given cfgEdge of the method's control flow graph. This method should be used whenever the reason for terminating a BoogiePL block is an explicit edge in the method's control flow graph. Beside the actual termination of the current BoogiePL block, this method treats back edges and other branches to loop headers specially by asserting the decreasing nature of loop variant expressions (only along back edges) and by keeping a copy of the current heap (only along non-back-edges to loop headers).

Parameters:
cfgEdge - The edge in the method's control flow graph which triggers the termination of the current BoogiePL block.

getLoopHeapVar

private java.lang.String getLoopHeapVar(BasicBlock cfgBlock)
Returns the name of the variable to use for storing a copy of the heap when entering the loop starting at the given basic block of the method's control flow graph.

Parameters:
cfgBlock - The basic block where the loop starts.
Returns:
The name of the loop heap variable.

getLoopVariantVar

private java.lang.String getLoopVariantVar(BMLLoopVariant variant)
Returns the name of the variable to use for storing a copy of the given loop variant expression at the beginning of a loop.

Parameters:
variant - The loop variant in question.
Returns:
The name of the variable to store the value of the loop variant expression.

blockLabel

private static java.lang.String blockLabel(BasicBlock cfgBlock)
Returns the label to be used for a BoogiePL block representing the given basic block of the method's control flow graph. The label is guaranteed to be unique.

Parameters:
cfgBlock - The basic block of the control flow graph.
Returns:
The label for the BoogiePL block.

Parameters:
exception - The exception by which the method terminated.
Returns:
The label to be used for the exceptional exit block.

defaultBlockLabel

private java.lang.String defaultBlockLabel(BasicBlock cfgBlock)
Returns the label to be used for the synthetic BoogiePL block which is generated for the default statement of a switch statement and which assumes that the constant of the switch statement has a value different from all the values handled by the individual case statements. The label is guaranteed to be unique.

Parameters:
cfgBlock - The basic block of the method's control flow graph in which the switch statement appears.
Returns:
The label to be used for the BoogiePL block.

normalPostBlockLabel

private java.lang.String normalPostBlockLabel(BasicBlock cfgBlock)
Returns the label to be used for the synthetic BoogiePL block which is generated for method calls having declared checked exceptions in case the method terminates without throwing any exception. The label is guaranteed to be unique.

Parameters:
cfgBlock - The basic block of the method's control flow graph in which the method call appears.
Returns:
The label to be used for the BoogiePL block.

exceptionalPostBlockLabel

private java.lang.String exceptionalPostBlockLabel(BasicBlock cfgBlock,
                                                   JType exception)
Returns the label to be used for the synthetic BoogiePL block which is generated for method calls having declared checked exceptions in case the method terminates by throwing the given exception. The label is guaranteed to be unique.

Parameters:
cfgBlock - The basic block of the method's control flow graph in which the method call appears.
exception - The exception thrown by the method.
Returns:
The label to be used for the BoogiePL block.

handlerBlockLabel

private java.lang.String handlerBlockLabel(BasicBlock cfgBlock,
                                           JType exception)
Returns the label to be used for the synthetic BoogiePL block which is generated for branches to exception handlers when some exception is thrown. The label is guaranteed to be unique.

Parameters:
cfgBlock - The basic block of the method's control flow graph in which the branch to the exception handler appears.
exception - The exception caught by the exception handler.
Returns:
The label to be used for the BoogiePL block.
